poem:
On Salary

In the gray 
of power,
discontent brews 
on numbers 
etched 
in papers.
Yellowed eyes 
weigh wage 
over worth.
Sue's sum tips
a delicate scale,
stirring whispers—
value not in service,
but in coin.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Minister rejects claim that Sue Gray showed ‘stunning arrogance’ accepting higher salary than Keir Starmer – UK politics live 11.53am BST Anushka Asthana from ITV has more on why Labour advisers are so angry about Sue Gray’s pay. She has posted a thread on social media. New- the reason Labour’s special advisers are so upset about this is many of them were put on standing salaries of £57k when they began, so Sue Gray is". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
